Posts.Content: Toni68 wrote: So I am finished 11 sessions of my 21 day rads schedule and my lungs feel....like I was outside skiing all day or in the cold. Is this normal? Been like that for past two days Go back Monday for 5 treatments then 5 booster. Thanks, T. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lungs hurt a wee bit Toni68 barbe1958

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2016 04:19PM Toni68 wrote: Hi barbe1958, I put the salt water in a sterilized thermos and bring my gauze packs all with me to work. I just go into the bathroom for ten mins and set it on the area that's been bothering me, not the entire area that's been radiated. I put one on before I go to work, when I get home from work and then before bed. Just space them out. My phone nstructions said to do this 3-4 times a day for 5 mins. You may get different instructions though. All the best Barb. Toni
Posts.Title: Lungs hurt a wee bit Toni68 barbe1958

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2016 12:18AM Toni68 wrote: Ok, thanks so much Hopeful. I will call the nurses line on Monday and see what they say. Toni
Posts.Title: Lungs hurt a wee bit Toni68 barbe1958

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2016 12:55PM Toni68 wrote: Hi barbe1958, They told me that it wouldn't be related to my radiation. I actually feel better now. It was just a few days I felt like that. I know some people develop a dry cough and I was thinking maybe it was just things getting really dry in my system or I was on the verge of a cold. I didn't get a cold and all is fine now except for the itching skin! The cream doesn't help the itching but the salt water saline they have you prepare and use several times a day really helps. One last all over breast treatment today and then onto my booster next week. Good luck with your radiation Barb. I hope all goes well. Toni
